titleInfo.title: Letter No. 38: William Hornby, Daniel Draper, Nathaniel Stackhouse, William Ashburner and Andrew Ramsay, Council at Bombay Castle, to John Beaumont, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: This letter, received 28 April 1780 by the EagleSnow ,includes extracts (no. 39) from the Company's commands of the 23 December 1778 and 27 May 1779, which were received via the Resolutionand the Hawke. The letter discusses the wool trade and states that this season's exports include 136 bales of broad cloth and 200 long ells for the Bushire market. The aforementioned extracts include: information regarding the reprimand of Captain Burnet Abercrombie; details of the appointment of a secret committee for arrangements for the safety of the Company's shipping; and a list of names of writers appointed by the Company for that season.
